name: Resorts World Sentosa - Hard Rock Hotel Singapore

reviews.text: This might be OK for a family holiday for the pool etc., but even then I would not recommend it. The worst problem is the smell, which is really bad in some areas. My room had a very damp smell, combined with cleaning agents. I know it was not just my room as I wnet to a colleagues room and it had the same problem but not so bad. Some of the public areas are similar. Other problems - the aircon control doesn't seem to work. It blew very cold air whatever the temperature setting. In the end the room got so cold that I had to turn it off and by the morning it was about right. The sound proofing between rooms is not good and I could hear the television and other noises next door. The bed and pillows are not very comfortable. The hot water ran out straight after my shower at about 8.30 and afterwards was only lukewarm. The waste water makes a lot of noise as if one of the traps isn't working properly - perhaps this is the source of the smell. There is a desk area for working but no chair! The furnishings are trendy and nice, but beginning to look tatty and worn already. The lighting system is unfathonable. I could go on, but that gives the picture.
reviews.title: Avoid

reviews.text: There are some good points. The pool area is nice, and the lobby area trendy with a nice bar. It's dark and noisy, but the right ambience. Lots of interestimng rock memorabilia around the place. Breakfast is OK, but not special. The rooms are a good size, and the bathroom well fitted out. Wifi worked well but is charged.
reviews.title: Rocking good times!

reviews.text: The conference facilities in the atttached confedrence centre were very good.
reviews.title: Nice swimming pool for family; inconsiderated design and bad service.

reviews.text: With all the choices available in Resort World in Sentosa, we choose Hard Rock based on its reputation and of course I'm a big rock fan!!
reviews.title: Fantastic swimming pool with artificial, clean beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon checking in, we have to wait for 2 hours due to shortage of large bed. But this is not a problem as we were given a pair of Complimentary tickets that allow us to travel to Vivo city and back for free.
reviews.title: Friendly staffs and Nice swimming pool

reviews.text: I was staying at the Hard Rock Hotel and attending a conference at the Conference Centre underneath the Hard Rock Hotel. Upon arrival the service was outstanding by ALL staff we came into contact with. Throughout our 7 nights every single person was friendly, professional and made us feel very welcome.
reviews.title: Outstanding Service but not sure about the rest ...
Family
reviews.text: Unfortunately we experienced a few issue ... the TV didn't work until the second day and needed 3 people to figure out the cable at the back was out!! We reported on our third night our toilet was leaking. Maintenance came to fix it ... by fix it I mean wipe up the water behind the toilet and place a towel on the floor. The toilet continued to leak and was wiped up by housekeeping each day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The general cleanliness of the room and hallways was questionable. Around the basin the grout was discolouring and the shower door and glass bathroom door didn't quite shut. The hallways looked like they needed a good vacuum. A room several doors up from us had something white spilt outside the door for two days!!
reviews.title: A real dissapointment after an otherwise great holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast each morning was average however dinner at the buffet was exceptional - best curries I think I've ever had. Room service offering was poor and quality was just ok. My colleague ordered potato wedges with sour cream. After dinner was delivered it was realised no sour cream was delivered. Upon calling room service we were told they had run out of sour cream!!! Free fruit and drinks made up for this!!!
reviews.title: Nice for Family with kids

reviews.text: Staff were brilliant on arrival - were booked into a king room but they showed us a twin which was better suited.
reviews.title: Best short vacation in a long long time.
Average hotel. Slightly disappointed
reviews.text: Stayed here for a night through the flash deal of 50% discount via booking on Agoda. Waited for more than 10 minutes to check in after which I was told that room wasn't ready. Front desk staff promised to give me a call once the room is ready; which they did promptly within half an hour.

Room is quite spacious. Stayed in the Deluxe King room which also includes a pull out bed. In room facilities were the standard facilities you can expect from most hotel, except they didn't have a soap in the toilet. The switches for the lights in the room were not very user friendly and 2 of the lights were faulty. In room TV had mostly Chinese channels and the reception was quite bad as the show was lagging intermittently. iPod dock in the room was average, sound quality was muffled. Housekeeping didn't bother greeting guests when I was walking along the doorway on my way to the gym.
reviews.title: Good place for kids

reviews.text: On side note, the hotel has kids/family oriented pools and excellent gym facilities. Overall, an average hotel suitable for family with kids. Will reconsider if I have to stay here again, the price doesn't justify the service standard.
reviews.title: Nice Pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel for 6 days. It was overall a good place for kids and toddlers. But it was more like 4-star hotel due to food issues.
reviews.title: Fun stay

reviews.text: This represents a general overview of most of the hotels in Resorts World Sentosa actually except for a few exceptions.
reviews.title: Rock stars might not stay here either

reviews.text: Generally, if you are after the level of service you find in 5 star hotels in the US, UK or Australia then generally you won't find it in a 5 star establishment in Singapore. That is because for the most part, they are still learning what service is.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: Pool was the highlight here with it split up between a kids artificial beach playground and water slide vs the quieter adults pool nearer the pool bar area.
reviews.title: ok but wouldnt stay again

reviews.text: The restaurant was OK. Nothing that made it stand out from other hotel restaurants. I did like the way the rooms were done up but otherwise, the service just lets the whole experience fall apart no matter how nice things are.
reviews.title: Great weekend getaway

reviews.text: If you are coming to stay here because you have a family with kids, then you will be generally happy. Again, don't expect 5 star service. The level of service deviates between 3 and 4 star hotels.
reviews.title: Very Convenient

description: Rock and roll attitude meets five-star service at the Hard Rock Hotel Singapore. Breathtaking design, fashionable dining options, and the legendary entertainment experience only Hard Rock can offer make this the obvious choice for those looking for a stay that is beyond the ordinary.If unique networking venues are what you need, the hotel is home to some of the resort's best meeting and conference facilities, and indoor exhibition space. This includes 30 function rooms and one of Asia's largest ballrooms with seating for 6,500 guests. All at the doorstep of Universal Studios Singapore ®, the world's largest oceanarium and Asia's newest casino resort.
